alert.note: Alert for Marion (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 12:18PM EST until March 06 at 2:12AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio... Scioto River Near Larue affecting Marion County. For the Scioto River...including Larue, Prospect...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Scioto River Near Larue. * WHEN...Moderate flooding until tonight, minor flooding until Sunday night. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, River at bankfull in the Village of La Rue. Widespread flooding on area roads including School Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EST Saturday was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 04/20/1940. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM EST.
